channel.title: The Subbuteo Argus
channel.description: The Subbuteo Argus is a weekly table football newsletter, covering table soccer news from FISTF-affiliated and WASPA-affiliated national associations.

item.title: Mettivieri crowned champion in Berlin
item.description:
Headlines

Mettivieri crowned champion at Berlin Grand Prix

Antonio Mettivieri defeated Italian player Saverio Bari 2-1 during extra time to lift the Berlin Grand Prix title, having overcome fellow Belgian Christopher Dhuer in the semi-finals. Meanwhile, Austrian player Stefan Sandner won the veterans title, Victoria Büsing the female category, and Alwin Krause won the U15 category, and was narrowly defeated in the U19 final by Fabio Bianco. Belgian club AS Hennuyer drew the team event final against a three man TFC Wiener Neustadt side, winning thanks to a bye for Olivier Pere.

All Greek for Hantzaras

Spyros Hantzaras defeated Lazaros Papakonstantinou to lift the Greek Grand Prix title, with surprise package Georgios Genitsaropoulous putting in an impressive performance to reach the semi-finals. Meanwhile, Falcons Athens overcame fierce rivals Atlas in the final of the team event.

Pawsey wins Glasgow Open

Fresh from topping the English National League the previous weekend, in-form Dave Pawsey won the International Open of Glasgow, defeating teammate Elliot Bellefontaine 4-1 in the final. Scottish legend David Baxter took home the veterans title after defeating Steve Bennett, whilst Yorkshire Phoenix pipped Dundee United to take the team title.

Ho stops Kenzo Koi’s dream in Yokohama

The game in East Asia continues to gain momentum, with 27 players competing for the Yokohama Open title. American player Andrea Gasparini came unstuck at the semi final stage against tournament organizer Kenzo Koi, with Singapore’s John Ho narrowly defeating Koi 1-0 in the final. Elsewhere, there were wins for Karibu Miwa (U15) and Kazunari Shigenobu (U19).

item.title: Valéry Victorious in Rochefort
item.description:
Headlines

Belgian GP title for Dejardin

Valéry Dejardin won the Belgian Grand Prix in Rochefort, defeating fellow countryman Sébastien Scheen in the final in a tournament which saw each of the semi-final berths taken by Belgian players. Pascal Scheen went one better, beating Frenchman Eric Lienhardt to lift the veteran category title, whilst ST Stembert lifted the team title.

item.title: Busch on top in thrilling climax in Vienna
item.description:
Headlines

David Busch on top thrilling finale to Wien West Satellite

David Busch won a high-scoring final that saw him throw away a two goal lead on three separate occasions against Erich Hinklemann, before finally putting the game to bed in sudden death extra time, winning the game 6-5. As reported last week, Hungarian player Gábor/ Baross made history with his semi-final placing at the FISTF Satellite in Vienna, although a full report and results from the event have now also become available.

Google translation

Baross crowned Hungarian Champion

Fresh back from his heroics in Vienna, Gábor Baross topped a group of eight to lift the first Hungarian Championship since 2013, with previous winner Csibor László in second place, two points behind, and Zoltan Baross in third place.

Google translation

item.title: FISTF Sports Director Resigns
item.description:
Headlines

FISTF Sports Director Resigns

Reports on the UK Subbuteo Forum say that George Drazinakas has resigned as FISTF Sports Director following events at the FISTF Champions League held in Belgium last weekend. Mike Parnaby added that both Drazinakas and the tournament organiser and former Sports Director Olivier Pere suffered from a range of controversial incidents, including red cards being ignored, rule breaking, and banned players taking part.

item.title: Reggio Emilia win FISTF Champions League
item.description:
Headlines

FISTF Champions League title for Reggio Emilia

Italian club Reggio Emilia claimed the Champions League title in Frameries (Belgium) last weekend, defeating fellow Italian club Fiamme Azzurre 3-0 in the final. Black & Blue Pisa made it an Italian 1-2-3 after defeating former winners SC Charleroi in the third place playoff. Meanwhile, Maltese side SC Valletta controversially won the Europa League title, having deliberately tried to avoid competing in the main competition.

Google translate version

Winning return for Glide, Slide, Chip & Dip club

A small, but well received International Open in Enderby saw Rudi Peterschnigg defeat Portuguese player Paolo Gouveia 1-0 to lift the Open category title, whilst Italian Claudio Dogali overcame Englishman David Pawsey in the veterans. Glide, Slide, Chip & Dip Club made a triumpant return to the UK game, topping a group of five to lift the team title.

item.title: Kegenbein wins his first DSTFB-Pokal
item.description:
Headlines

Kegenbein wins 2015 DSTFB-Pokal

Bjorn Kegenbein lifted this year’s German Cup, defeating SC München player Roland Popp 7-3 in a thrilling finale. The player dominated the tournament throughout to lift the trophy for the first time in his career. Meanwhile, Berlin side Sparta Spreeathen 74/82 won the team trophy, defeating reigning champions TSL Dortmund in a closely contested final.

item.title: Brazil dominate South American Championship
item.description:
Headlines

Brazil dominate South American Championship

Brazil defeated Argentina 4-0 in the final of the South American Championships to draw the two nations level in the total number of victories in that competition. Meanwhile, CR Vasco da Gama topped a group including SE Palmeiras and AS Rosario to win the team competition, whilst reigning champion Ednilson Gaffo retained his individual crown, beating Fleix Londrina teammate Rony Suzuky 2-0 in the final.

Alberto Mateos lifts IO Estepa title

Alberto Mateos took the scalp of FISTF World Player of the Year Juan Noguera at the International Open of Estepa, defeating him 4-2 in the final ahead of a Spanish record field of 80 players and 16 teams. Meanwhile, the Spanish veteran side continued their winning streak, defeating a team from Gibraltar in an international friendly, whilst Tiborones FM took home the team title, cruising to a 3-0 victory over Belgian side Stembert.

Chris Thomas wins in Melbourne IO

Chris Thomas took the International Open of Melbourne trophy back to England with him, defeating his brother Peter, now based in Australia, 4-0. Both players had progressed comfortably to the final, with Peter defeating Elliot Kennedy 3-0 in one semi final, and Chris thrashing Fabrizio Coco 5-0 in the other.

item.title: Four join Belgian Division 1
item.description:
Headlines

Four join Belgian Division 1

Michaël Casciano made a triumphant return to the top flight of the Belgian league last weekend, topping the qualification tournament table, with Philippe Roufosse (2nd), Geoffrey Marain (3rd), and Delphine Dieudonné (4th) joining him. The tournament, hosted by AS Hennuyer, saw 46 players compete for places in the Belgian Division 1, to be hosted in Eugies and Templeuve, along with a third venue which is yet to be decided.

Google translate version

item.title: Flores becomes World Champion
item.description:
Headlines

World Cup joy for Flores

Spanish player Carlos Flores stormed to victory in the FISTF World Cup last weekend, defeating Massimiliano Nastasi - himself a former champion - to lift the trophy for the third time to equal Massimo Bolognino’s record, whilst keeping the trophy in Spain for the fourth consecutive season. His 3-2 semi-final win against Daniele Bertelli was his lowest scoring game of the tournament, notching up a 45-17 goal difference over his 8 games, an astonishing 7.75 goals per match.

Spain dominant at World Cup

Spain put in a dominant performance at the World Cup, taking the Open and Under 19 category titles, along with the Open and Veteran team titles. Credit must surely go to Greek player Nikos Beis, whose 1-0 victory over Angel Valverde in the quarter final represented the only defeat of a player in the Spanish open team for the entire competition, as the side strolled to a 2-0 victory over Austria in the final. Google translate version
